messages.title: Charity begins at home
messages.content: Jeff Clarke and the Conservative Action Team support events that help local charities. The walk through the Birkenhead Tunnel in the summer is a good example. Jeff is pictured with colleague Councillor Cherry Povall at the mid-point of the tunnel.

messages.title: CAMPAIGNING in our community
messages.content: Jeff with residents at one of the many demonstrations against library closures.

messages.title: Investing in Our Young People
messages.content: The issue which is raised time and again when talking to young people is that they too often have nowhere to go and nothing to do. 'We owe it to our young people to provide a variety of 'safe places' with at least some educational benefit.'

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposition to the closure of many of the Borough's libraries.
Proposal to provide young people with a variety of 'safe places' with educational benefits.

issues.environment: Support for local charities through participation in events like a walk through the Birkenhead Tunnel.
issues.governance: Opposition to library closures and addressing the strategic asset review.

leaflet.personalStatement: 'It has been a privilege to listen to the legion of committed residents who were not willing to campaign alongside us to allow essential local facilities to close. Our elected representatives must reflect the priorities of their electorate.'
